mads.note: Brill's New Pauly: "Andromachus,the Elder, from Crete Personal physician of Nero, Known through a poem with 87 distichs, in which he described his antidote later called theriac (Ps.-Gal. 14,308), Galene (Gal. 14,32,270), which was valued above the famous mithridatium of Mithridates V and which was sold by doctors and quacks....." Nutton, Vivian (London). “Andromachus”, in: Brill’s New Pauly, Antiquity volumes edited by: Hubert Cancik and , Helmuth Schneider. Consulted online on 29 September 2017
